def: Tufted cord, of silk or worsted, for the trimimg of ladies'dresses, for embroidery and fringes, and for the weft of chenillerugs.
Of the nature of a provision; serving as a provision for thetime being; -- used of partial or temporary arrangements; as, aprovisional government; a provisional treaty.

The common designation of one a sect founded by the Rev. EdwardIrving (about 1830), who call themselves the Catholic ApostolicChurch. They are highly ritualistic in worship, have an elaboratehierarchy of apostles, prophets, etc., and look for the speedy comingof Christ.
To remove the face or cover from; to unmask; to expose.
To bind up,as in a knot; to include. [Obs.] Fuller.
One who loafs; a lazy lounger. Lowell.

The art or act of determining the directions and heights of thelines of rampart with reference to the protection of the interiorfrom exposure to an enemy's fire from any point within range, or fromany works which may be erected. Farrow.
To load again, as a gun.
Good against intestinal worms.-- An anthelmintic remedy. [Written also anthelminthic.]
